pma:database.name: cospas_staging
pma:database.pma:table: CREATE TABLE `joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons` ( `id` int(11) unsigned NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT, `database_id` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `tac_rev_history` text NOT NULL, `name` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `model_add_names` text NOT NULL, `manufacturer_id` int(11) NOT NULL, `manufacturers_group` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `tac_number` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `previous_names` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `original_tac_issue_date` date NOT NULL, `tac_last_revision_date` date NOT NULL, `report_last_revision_date` date NOT NULL, `battery` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `battery_cell` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `classes` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `message_format` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `protocols_tested` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `approved_protocols` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `rls_capability` tinyint(1) NOT NULL, `production_status` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `beacon_type` int(11) NOT NULL, `beacon_frequency_channel` int(11) NOT NULL, `homer_frequency` int(11) NOT NULL, `homer_duty_cycle` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `homer_power` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `ref_oscillator_type` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `ref_osc_manufacturer` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `ref_osc_part_number` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `strobe_light` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `strobe_brightness` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `strobe_duty_cycle` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `antenna_separable` tinyint(1) NOT NULL, `voice_tx_frequency` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `tested_life` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `nav_device` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `gnss_system` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `gnss_system_text` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `nav_device_model` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `interface_to_ext_navigation` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `self_test` tinyint(1) NOT NULL, `self_test_rf` tinyint(1) NOT NULL, `self_test_duration` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `self_test_flag` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `self_test_15_hex_id` tinyint(1) NOT NULL, `gnss_self_test` tinyint(1) NOT NULL, `approved_antenna_model` text NOT NULL, `add_functions` text NOT NULL, `change_notice_history` text NOT NULL, `non_compliances` text NOT NULL, `beacon_picture1` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `beacon_picture2` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `beacon_picture3` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `tested_configurations` text NOT NULL, `applicable_specification` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `applicable_ta_standard` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `approved_by` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `state` tinyint(3) NOT NULL, `general_comments` text NOT NULL, `operational_comments` text NOT NULL, `secretariat_comments` text NOT NULL, `other_objects` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `modified` datetime NOT NULL, `original_ta_test_facility` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `created` datetime NOT NULL DEFAULT '0000-00-00 00:00:00', `created_by` int(11) NOT NULL, `modified_by` int(10) NOT NULL, `checked_out` int(10) NOT NULL, `checked_out_time` datetime NOT NULL DEFAULT '0000-00-00 00:00:00', PRIMARY KEY (`id`) ) ENGINE=InnoDB AUTO_INCREMENT=3836 DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8;

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: 1) 26 Mar 93; 2) 8 Aug 01; 3) 10 Dec 04: approved for use with ACR OCXO-50 or MC OCXOVT-SAR 406.028 MHz oscilators and Chelton 2614 antenna ; 4) Sept 06: New beacon encoding tool approved; 5)13-Apr-10: ELT96 Amendment J and ELT97 Amendment D approved

Business rights of distress beacons were purchased by Air Precision from Socata in July 2001. Model "ELT 96 Amendment J" is identical to the model ELT96 except: the upgraded SW, a non-truncated self-test message of 440 ms; approved for use with the following User Protocols variants: ELT with Aircraft 24-bit address, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator and Serial Number, ELT with Serial Number, Aviation User.

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: 1) 26 Mar 93; 2) 8 Aug 01; 3) 10 Dec 04: approved for use with ACR OCXO-50 or MC OCXOVT-SAR 406.028 MHz oscilators and Chelton 2614 antenna ; 4) Sept 06: New beacon encoding tool approved; 5)13-Apr-10: ELT96 Amendment J and ELT97 Amendment D approved

Business rights of distress beacons were purchased by Air Precision from Socata in July 2001. Model ELT97 is identical to the model ELT 96 except G-switch. Model "ELT97 Amendment D" is identical to the model ELT97, except the upgraded SW, a non-truncated self-test message of 440 ms; approved for use with the following User Protocols variants: ELT with Aircraft 24-bit address, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator and Serial Number, ELT with Serial Number, Aviation User.

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Oscillator replacement by identical accepted 15 November 2001

Mechanical shock sensor. Tested only with Procom SCA3 det whip antenna. Oscillator SOREP OCXO EW OS 0501 replaced by identical SOREP OCXO EW OS 0501/B. Change Notice Form 15 November 2001, C-S accepted November 2001

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: 1) Change Notice Form 19 July 02 - 406 MHz transmitter of the beacon modified, C-S accepted: 19 Aug 02 - class 2, 18 Nov 02 - class 1; 2) Change Notice Form 29 Aug 02, 17 Sep 02 - C-S acceptance as Non Float-free EPIRB

1) From bcn S/N 345 300 the UHF transistors are replaced by hybrid RF power amplifier Mitsubishi M68732L in 406 MHz transmitter, C-S accepted 18 November 02; 2) 17 Sep 02 acceptance as Non Float-free EPIRB (with collar)

(France); 9) 3-Aug-12: Models on 105-3 approved for use with alternative OCXOVT-XY, RCP-100 and RCP200 and external buzzer; 10)27-Jan-14: alt. antennas Chelton 2632-82 and HR Smith 10-118-32-2 approved for use with 'Kannad 406 AF (amdt G or higher)'
Originally tested as a survival ELT with PROCOM SCA3 antenna. Approved with following aircraft mounted antennas: Chelton 1327-82, 2614-82 & 2624-82, and Dayton Granger 720063.

Oscillator SOREP OCXO EW OS 0501 replaced by identical SOREP OCXO EW OS 0501/B. Change Notice Form 15 November 2001, C-S accepted 19 November 2001. Authorised to use either Thales oscillator EW OS 501/B or EWOS 501/C as of 4 May 2005. NOTE for CUSTOMERS: For technical support, battery replacement and other matters related to customer support - please contact Orolia S.A.S. (France).

Can be used without and with external navigation device (GPS); Nav. Interface: RS422. Self-test mode: 406 MHz carrier for 20 ms, 121.5 MHz for less than 1 sec; self-tested parameters: battery voltage, RF power, PLL.

table.column: (1) 7-Sep-05: Model 2200 was accepted; (2) 19-Apr-07: Approved for use with GPS module (Ublox TIM-4H) and FAS749-02 antenna in remote configuration with lifejacket hinge and conterpoise; (3) 4-May-07: differences between models 2100&2200 clarified; (4) 11-Jun-07: approved for use with the aternative 'uBlox ANN-MS' active GPS antenna; (5) 30-Jul-07: Class-1 models 'Fernau 2100B/2200B' without voice transceiver approved; (6) 15-Aug-07: Message coding clarified; (7) 29-Dec-10: Companuy name changed from Fernau Avionics Ltd, to Moog Fernau Limited; (8) 1-May-13;:software upgrade to V.3.12.12 approved for models Fernau 2100 and Fernau 2200.
TIM-4H (Ublox) with Motorola 'ONCORE Active HAWK' GPS antenna or uBlox 'ANN-MS' active GPS antenna
121.5/243 MHz voice transceiver; automatic activation (via "water switch" or release pin)

Deliberate misuse of the beacon, outside of the recommended operating procedures could cause the battery premature depletion and decrease of rated lifetime below 48 hours. Fernau 2100 does NOT have secure data burst mode. Beacon separable antenna (FAS749-02) approved for use in remote configuration with optional life-jacket hinge and counterpoise (P/N 0-140-FAU.27A). Type approved with the following Location protocols: PLB with Serial Number, Standard Location: PLB with Serial Number, National Location: PLB.
Deliberate misuse of the beacon, outside of the recommended operating procedures could cause the battery premature depletion and decrease of rated lifetime below 48 hours

Lithium-Sulfur Dioxide (Li-SO2),SAFT G54/3, 3 serially connected 5/4 C-size cells
GPS receiver manufacturered by Fastrax, model: iTrax03s
- Integrated AM-voice transceiver (output power 50 mW); - Automatic beacon activation via water sensor or lanyard (seat ejection).

Special use beacon. Tested in PLB configurations with integrated antenna only, corresponding to "on ground" and "above ground" configurations. Fully C/S compliant beacon with 406 MHz bursts transmitted in all modes and not affected by other communication signals. Approved for message encoding with: National User protocol (long message); all variants of National Location and Standard Location protocols; and User-Location protocol variants (Maritime with MMSI, Maritime with Radio Call Sign, Radio Call Sign, Aviation and PLB with Serial Number). Variants of generic model name MR510-xx-(x1x) indicate to beacon housing color (green/yellow) and marking languages (English/German/French).
Company name was changed from Becker Flugfunkwerk GmbH to Becker Avionics GmbH, effective 17.10.2013.
TCXO E4574LF, Non compl. MTS Slope and Resid during Lifetime at min.temp for first 10 mins

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: primary non-rechargeable: Li-Thionyl-Chloride, SAFT LSH-14, 2xC-cells; secondary rechargeable: Li-Ion SAFT MP 144350, 1 cell.

Automatic activation via water sensor; GNSS self-test ( 1 burst of 520 ms); AM voice-transceiver ( for use in Emergency mode only); Optional secodary functions (Display of current position and Route tracking) when powered by rechargeable battery.

Type approved with the following variants of Standard Location protocols: ELT with 24-bit Address, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator, ELT with Serial Number, PLB with Serial Number; variants of User-Location protocol: Aviation, ELT with Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft Operator and Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft 24-bit Address, PLB with Serial Number; and variants of National Location Protocol for ELT and PLB. The beacon optional secodary functions (indication of current current position geographical coordinates, and route tracking) are available only when the rechargeable battery is connected. Beacon was tested in PLB configurations only, corresponding to beacon operation while "on ground" and "above ground", and while floating in water when placed in a floatation-assisting bag.

121.5/243 MHz voice-transceiver; 121.5/243 MHz SarFind messaging
Automatic beacon activation via a salt-water sensor, or via a G-switch, or on ejection from an aircraft by removal of an activation pin.
Multiple programmable and selectable mode options, including: 406 MHz-enabled modes, non-406 MHz beacon modes, and non-beacon (C-SAR) modes of operation.

Military beacon designated for operation by ualified and trained pesonnel.
SARBE G2R ELT has been tested and approved for operation only in "on-ground" and "above-ground" scenarios, in SAR-Mode with the Beacon/Voice/SarFind Data option enabled. Other SAR-mode configuration options and the Combat mode (C-SAR) have not been tested nor approved by Cospas-Sarsat.
An overuse of the non-406MHz programmable modes and operator-controlled ancillery options may prematurely deplete battery. Tested to 10.6 hrs operating lifetime, thus approved with LoC. For details of operational and design limitations, customers should contact the beacon manufacturer.
Approved for message encoding with variants of the User-Location protocol (Aviation, ELT with Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft Designator and Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft 24-bit Address) , and with variants of the Standard Location protocol (ELT with 24-bit Address, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator, ELT with Serial Number).

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Beacon laboratory testing IAW Cospas-Sarsat requirements confirmed operational life exceeds 24 hours. Testing by manufacturer confirms operational life greater than 48 hours. Self-test transmits only in the maintenance mode. Beacon mounted on airfoil that also includes a voice and data recorder. The airfoil separates from aircraft in distress situation.

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Lithium Manganese Dioxide (Li-MnO2), Mathews Associates (12 cells of 1794AS0953-type)
Proprietary GPS receiver by General Dynamics based on Motorolla chipset

Special use beacon, for operation by trained personnel. Sarsat Mode 1 is fully compliant, however TAC not issued, as 406 MHz transmission can be interrupted in Sarsat Mode 2. Furthermore, over-use of voice transceiver, 121.5/243 MHz swept-tone beacon and other operator-selectable features and modes (other than Sarsat Mode 1) may cause premature depletion of the beacon battery.
fully compatible with Cospas-Sarsat standards only when operated in SARSAT Mode 1

(France); (5) 2-Apr-12: TAC-709 (LoC) re-issued in the name of Orolia S.A.S. (France); (6) 16-May-13: SARBE 6-406G approved for use with detachable transmitting antenna P/N 101917
Lithium Manganese Dioxide (Li-MnO2), Duracell ULTRA 123 CR, (8 cells of CR 123A type)

detachable transmitting antenna P/N 101323 with a radial element P/N 101436; separable active GPS "patch" antenna P/N 101322; separable active GPS "stub" antenna P/N 101453 (alternative P/N 83-200); detachable transmitting antenna P/N 101917.

Tested and approved for operation only in "on-ground" and "above-ground" scenarios. Approved for encoding with the variants of User-Location and Standard Location protocols (except Serial User-Location protocol for Float Free EPIRB with Serial Number). Special use beacon, for operation by trained personnel. Demonstrated compliance with C/S requirements during 24 hours lifetime at minimum temperature test, with moderate use of voice-transceiver. Over-use of voice transceiver may cause premature depletion of the beacon battery and affect beacon ability to transmit 406 MHz signals for the specified operating lifetime (24 hours). NOTE for CUSTOMERS: For technical support, battery replacement and other matters related to customer support - please contact OroliaS.A.S. (France).

detachable transmitting antenna P/N 101323 with a radial element P/N 101436

Approved for encoding with National User protocol . Beacon was tested only in PLB configuration. Special use beacon, for operation by trained personnel. Demonstrated compliance with C/S requirements during 24 hours lifetime at minimum temperature test, with moderate use of voice-transceiver. Over-use of voice transceiver may cause premature depletion of the beacon battery and affect beacon ability to transmit 406 MHz signals for the specified operating lifetime (24 hours). NOTE for CUSTOMERS: For technical support, battery replacement and other matters related to customer support - please contact Orolia S.A.S. (France).

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Lithium Manganese Dioxide (Li-MnO2), SAFT LM2650012, 3 cells of "C"-size
AM-voice transceiver, two-way data messaging, self-navigation, LCD display, automatic activation on ejection from aircraft (G-switch)

Special use beacon, for operation by trained personnel. Tested in PLB configuration only, corresponding to beacon operation while "on ground" and "above ground". Demonstrated compliance during lifetime test for 15-hours in BCN-mode (State B+C) and for 24 hours in BCN-mode (State C). Over-use of voice transceiver and other ancillary functions may cause premature depletion of the beacon battery and affect beacon ability to transmit 406 MHz signals for the specified operating lifetime (15 hours).

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Lithium Manganese Dioxide (Li-MnO2), SAFT LM2650012, 3 cells of "C"-size
AM-voice transceiver, self-navigation, LCD display, automatic activation on ejection from aircraft (G-switch), automatic activation (lanyard)

Special use beacon, variant of base PRC-434G/CS model, for operation by trained personnel. Tested in PLB configuration only, corresponding to beacon operation while "on ground" and "above ground". Demonstrated compliance during lifetime test for 15-hours in BCN-mode (State B+C) and for 24 hours in BCN-mode (State C). Over-use of voice transceiver and other ancillary functions may cause premature depletion of the beacon battery and affect beacon ability to transmit 406 MHz signals for the specified operating lifetime (15 hours).

Special use beacon, for operation by trained personnel. Tested in PLB configuration only, corresponding to beacon operation while "on ground" and "above ground" with integrated antenna and "above ground" with external antennae. Mode 1 and Mode 3 are fully compliant, however TAC not issued, as over-use of Mode-2 , a non-406 MHz mode with 121.5/243 MHz swept-tone beacon only may cause premature depletion of the beacon battery. Approved for message encoding with Standard Location protocol variant for PLB with Serial Number. NOTE FOR CUSTOMERS: For technical support, battery replacement and customer support matters please contact ACR Electronics, Inc - USA

USB and IrDa interfaces for remote self-test

Special use beacon, for operation by trained personnel. Tested in PLB configuration with integrated antenna only, corresponding to beacon operation while "on ground" and "above ground" . Mode 1 and Mode 3 are fully compliant, however TAC not issued, as over-use of Mode-2 , a non-406 MHz mode with 121.5/243 MHz swept-tone beacon only, may cause premature depletion of the beacon battery. Approved for message encoding with National Location protocol for PLB. NOTE for CUSTOMERS: For technical support, battery replacement and other customer support matters please contact Orolia S.A.S. (France).

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Lithium/Bromide Chloride, Electrochem P/N 3B70, 1 (one) C-size cell
Integral blade antenna (P/N MEA-25000-2101), detachable trailing VHF/UHF antenna (P/N MEA-25000-2201), detachable trailing GPS antenna (P/N MEA-25000-2301)
Automatic electrical or mechanical beacon activation on ejection from aircraft, automatic switching to integrated antenna, ACES II/III Control/Activation assembly

Special use beacon, for operation by trained personnel. Tested in PLB configuration only, corresponding to beacon operation while "on ground" and "above ground" with integrated antenna and "above ground" with detachable trailing antennae. "406 ONLY" mode and "TRIPLE BEACON" mode are fully compliant, however TAC not issued, as over-use of "DUAL BEACON" mode, a non-406 MHz mode with 121.5/243 MHz swept-tone beacon only may cause premature depletion of the beacon battery. Approved for message encoding with National Location for PLB and Standard Location protocol variant for PLB with Serial Number.

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Special use beacon, for operation by trained personnel. Tested in Survival ELT configurations only, corresponding to beacon operation while "on ground" and "above ground". Mode "Mayak" is fully compliant, however TAC not issued, as over-use of Mode "Sviaz" , a simplex voice AM-transceiver mode may cause premature depletion of the beacon battery. Approved for message encoding with variants of User protocol for: Aviation User, ELT with Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator and Serial Number, and ELT with Aircraft 24-bit Address..

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: 1) 31-Dec-09: Original TAC-715 assigned to MR510; 2) 15-Jul-10: Additional names added with generic model name:MR510-xx-(x2x) ; 3) 11-Jan-12: Production of MR510 beacons under TAC-715 has been suspended, production status was changed to "Discontinued".
Generic model name: MR510-xx-(x2x). Note: Variants of the generic name indicate to beacon housing color (green/yellow) and marking languages (English/German/French)
Lithium-Sulfur Dioxide (Li-SO2),SAFT G54/3, 3 serially connected 5/4 C-size cells
- Integrated AM-voice transceiver (output power 50 mW); - Automatic beacon activation via water sensor or lanyard (seat ejection).

Special use beacon, for operation by trained personnel. Tested in PLB configurations with integrated antenna only, corresponding to "on ground" and "above ground" configurations.BEACON Mode is fully compliant, however full TAC was not issued, as over-use of VOICE mode, a non-406 MHz mode for simplex two-way voice communications on 121.5/243 MHz, might impair the ability of the beacon to transmit 406 MHz signals for its minimum specified operating lifetime (24 hours at -20 C). Approved for message encoding with: National User protocol (long message); all variants of National Location and Standard Location protocols; and User-Location protocol variants (Maritime with MMSI, Maritime with Radio Call Sign, Radio Call Sign, Aviation and PLB with Serial Number).
Company name was changed from Becker Flugfunkwerk GmbH to Becker Avionics GmbH, effective 17.10.2013

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Lithium/Bromide Chloride, Electrochem P/N 3B75 (3B0075-TC), 1 (one) D-size cell
internal GPS receiver, manufacturer: Origion, model: ORG-1315
Integral antenna, and detachable antenna Tadiran P/N 2155911010

Automatic activation in the selected BEACON mode: on ejection from an aircraft or via magnetic actuator by pulling a lanyard; voice transceiver for half-duplex communication on 121.5,243 or 282.8 MHz with PTT(push-to-talk) and speaker volume controls

Special use beacon, for operation by trained military personnel. Tested with integrated antenna in PLB configurations corresponding to operation while "on ground" and "above ground", and with detachable antenna in the "above ground" configuration only. Detachable antenna is for use during descent phase after ejection. "Single BEACON" and "Triple BEACON" modes are fully compliant, however full TAC was not issued, as over-use of "VOICE" mode, a non-406 MHz mode for half-duplex two-way voice communications on 121.5/243/282.8 MHz, or a "Dual BEACON" mode with homer signals only on on 121.5 and 243 MHz, might impair the ability of the beacon to transmit 406 MHz signals for its minimum specified operating lifetime (24 hours at -20 C). Approved for message encoding with: National Location protocol for PLB and Standard Location protocol for PLB with Serial Number.

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Lithium-Ion LIRB, Li-Ion NMC/Si, PROLLION INP63438 rechargeable battery, manufacturer: Prollion, France

EMERGENCY is a wrist-worn 406/121.5 MHz emergency PLB which shares casing with a Breitling analog-digital chronograph. The chronograph and the emergency beacon are fully independent. 121.5 MHz homer operates only at temperatures above 0C, homer is automatically disabled at temperatures below 0C. Designed for operation only above ground. Not designed to operate while in water or when the watch is still worn on the wrist. The Li-Ion rechargeable battery shall be fully charged, the battery recharging shall be performed at regular, not exceeding 2 months intervals. Minimum duration of operation is 18 hrs. Approved for message encoding with the User protocol variant for PLBs with Serial Number. Designated for use of qualified and properly instructed customers.

can be supplied with Program Adapter to program aircraft 24 bit & tail number; type of protocol corresponds to the protocol resident in Program Adapter; Reference Oscillator EWOS 0500-1/B replaced by EWOS 0500-1/B-1 (19 Aug 03); Approved with alternative RF module P/N 452-0124 and battery pack P/N 45-0133 (19 Jan 07); Approved with upgraded SW version P/N 510-0136 Rev. A (17 May 07). NOTE Re. Self-test: Self-test results in transmission of a single 406 MHz burst, duration: of 440 ms or 520 ms, subject to the format flag bit. NOTE FOR CUSTOMERS: For technical support, battery replacement and customer support matters please contact ACR Electronics, Inc - USA. Approved for message encoding with variants of User protocol (Aviation, ELT with Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft 24-bit Address), User-Location protocol (Aviation), Standard Location protocol (ELT with 24-bit address, ELT with Serial Number) and National Location protocol for ELTs.
If no nav signal detected the location protocol message contain default data; user protocol beacons disregard location data

1)Tested in all EPIRB configurations, corresponding to beacon used while floating in water, in a safety raft and above above ground.

The minimum permitted attenuation in the coaxial is 0 dB at 406 MHz, except for RAMI AV-100 (0.3dB)
Detachable antenna: Procom SCA3-BNC (for AP application)

Approved for encoding with variants of Standard Location Protocol ( ELT with 24-bit address, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator, ELT with Serial Number), National Location Protocol for ELT, and User-Location Protocol (Aviation, ELT with Serial Number, ELT with Aircrat Operator and Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft 24-bit address).
Tested with all external fixed antennas as ELT (AF) in ELT configuration, and with auxiliary detachable antenna as ELT(AP) in PLB-configurations, i.e. "on ground" and "above ground".
AF-H/AP-H helicopter variants have G-switch placed at 45-degrees angle versus PCP. plane.
E5573LF Class 1 (Residual limit < 1 ppb); Navigation system is ungraded to C/S T.001 Issue 3 Rev.14, tests as per C/S T.007 Issue 4 Rev.8 - Oct 2013.

table.column: Lithium Thionyl Chloride, EVE Energy Battery Co., Ltd., cell model: ER34615M, 4 x D-size cells, battery pack NSR P/N NBT400

Voyage Data Recorder (VDR) memory module
Automatic activation via water contacts

Tested in all EPIRB configurations, corresponding to beacon used while floating in water, in a safety raft and above above ground. Approved for message encoding with maritime variants of Standard Location Protocol (EPIRB with MMSI and EPIRB with Serial Number), National Location Protocol for EPIRB, and User-Location Protocol (Maritime with MMSI, Maritime with Radio Call Sign, EPIRB Float Free with Serial Number).

(1) The model PLB-375(ResQLink+) is identical to the base model PLB-375, but it has a higher volume case, slightly increased weight, changed center of gravity and added buoyancy. Special use beacon, for operation by a trained personnel.

The beacon with the detachable transmitting trailing antenna is approved while it is placed above ground for operation.
"406 ONLY" mode and "TRIPLE BEACON" mode are fully compliant, however full type approval was not granted, as an over-use of the "DUAL BEACON" mode (i.e., a non-406 MHz mode with 121.5/243 MHz swept-tone homer only) might cause a premature depletion of the beacon battery.

Lithium-Thionyl Chloride, cell manufacturer: Great Power E&T Corp. Ltd., cell model: ER34615M, battery pack P/N MLB5.908.001, battery pack composition: 4 serially- connected D-size cells

1)Tested in all EPIRB configurations, corresponding to beacon used while floating in water, in a safety raft and above above ground.
2)Approved for message encoding with all maritime variants of User Protocol, National User Protocol (short and long message), Standard Location Protocol variants (EPIRB with MMSI and EPIRB with Serial Number), National Location protocol for EPIRB and all maritime variants of User-Location Protocol.
3) Model "VEP8V" is a variant of the base model "VEP8" with a larger beacon body. Model "VEP8V" is equipped with a voyage-data recorder (VDR) module, a 121.5 MHz homer transmitting a Morse code "V", and tested for operating lifetime of 168 hours.

table.column: ResQLink+, 3Si Guardian Buoyant 406 MHz Personal Locator Beacon
PANASONIC CR123A, Lithium Manganese Dioxide (3 cells, 2/3 A size)
GlobalTop Tech Inc. model Gms-hpr, ACR P/N A1-11-0877-1.

(1) The model PLB-375(ResQLink+) is identical to the base model PLB-375, but it has a higher volume case, slightly increased weight, changed center of gravity and added buoyancy. The model "PLB-375 (ResQLink+)" is approved for use while on ground or above ground, it has not been evaluated nor type approved for use while floating in water.
(2) Approved for message encoding with variants of Standard Location Protocol for EPIRB with MMSI, EPIRB with Serial Number, ELT with 24-bit Address, ELT with Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator and PLB with Serial Number, and variants of National Location Protocols for EPIRB, ELT and PLB.

Special-use EPIRB designed for submarines. Approved for use while floating in water. Due to specifics of a non-standard variant of the National User protocol (long message format), the beacon was approved with a letter of compatibility issued in-lieu of a full type-approval certificate.

Model "E-04C" is a variant of the base model "E-04" equipped with the alternative remote control panel P/N E-04.5.1 and the alternative control cable & connector. E-04C doesn't support position update feature, but capable to accept position from external device prior to beacon activation. Approved for message encoding with Standard Location protocols : ELT with 24-bit address, ELT with Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator; Tested as ELT (AF) with external fixed antenna.

ACK E-04.8 (whip), Sensor Systems S65-1231 (blade), Comant CI 319 (blade), RAMI AV-300 (rod)
automatic activation via G-switch; remote control panel P/N E-04.5.1; external audio alert indicator P/N E-04.10.1.5

Model "E-04C" is a variant of the base model "E-04" equipped with the alternative remote control panel P/N E-04.5.1 and the alternative control cable & connector. E-04C doesn't support position update feature, but capable to accept position from external device prior to beacon activation. Approved for message encoding with Standard Location protocols : ELT with 24-bit address, ELT with Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator; Tested as ELT (AF) with external fixed antenna.

table.column: Ultralife U10014, Lithium-Manganese Dioxide, 3 x D-size cells

Special-use EPIRB designed for submarines. Approved for use while floating in water. Due to specifics of a non-standard variant of the National User protocol (long message format), the beacon was approved with a letter of compatibility issued in-lieu of a full type-approval certificate.

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: 1) 10-Sep-15: TAC 718 was assigned and a Letter of Compatibility was issued for model "T-1630/SRT Buoy, Radio Transmitting SEPIRB". 2) 10-May-16: model "T-1630A/SRT" was added to TAC 718, production of model "T-1630/SRT Buoy, Radio Transmitting SEPIRB" was discontinued.
Ultralife U10014, Lithium-Manganese Dioxide, 3 x D-size cells

Special-use EPIRB designed for submarines. Approved for use while floating in water. Approved for message encoding with User-National (long format message) protocol.
Due to specifics of message protocol and some non-compliances, the beacon was approved with a letter of compatibility issued in-lieu of a full type-approval certificate.

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: 1) 25-Nov-08: Model "SEIPLB-25" (AN/URT-44) approved with TAC 713 and a Letter of Compatibility issued in-liue of the full type-approval certificate; 2) 13-Aug-15: Model "SEIPLB-25B" (AN/URT-44B) was approved with a letter of compatibility issued in-lieu of a full type-approval certificate, and added to TAC 713.
Lithium/Bromide Chloride, Electrochem type BCX 85 P/N 3B70, 1 (one) C-size cell
Integral transmitting blade antenna (P/N MEA-25000-2103), detachable transmitting trailing antenna (P/N MEA-25000-2205), detachable GPS-receiving trailing antenna (P/N MEA-25000-2301)
Automatic electrical or mechanical beacon activation on ejection from aircraft, ACES II/III Control/Activation assembly, automatic switching to integrated antenna.

Special use beacon, for operation by a trained personnel.
Tested in PLB configurations only, corresponding to beacon operation while "on ground" and "above ground".
The beacon with the integral transmitting blade antenna is approved while it is placed on ground or above ground for operation.
The beacon with the detachable transmitting trailing antenna is approved while it is placed above ground for operation.
"406 ONLY" mode and "TRIPLE BEACON" mode are fully compliant, however full type approval was not granted, as an over-use of the "DUAL BEACON" mode (i.e., a non-406 MHz mode with 121.5/243 MHz swept-tone homer only) might cause a premature depletion of the beacon battery.
Approved for message encoding with the National Location protocol for PLB and the Standard Location protocol for PLB with Serial Number.

table.column: 1) 11-Jul-11: originally approved with TAC 219; 2) 9-Sep-11: additional message protocols added; 3) 10-Nov-11: approval of a bouyant variant of PLB-375, model "PLB-375 (ResQLink+)"; 4) 20-Jan-12: First additional TAC 224 issued; 5) 9-Aug-12: Second additional TAC 233 issued; 6) 3-May-13: Third additional TAC 241 issued; 7) 4-Nov-13: Fouth additional TAC 245 issued; 8) 14-Nov-13: Alternative GPS receiver added, GlobalTop Tech Inc. model Gms-hpr, ACR P/N A1-11-0877-1; 9) 29-Jul-14: Fifth additional TAC 254 issued; 10) 18-Dec-14: Sixth additional TAC 257 issued; 11) 29-May-15: Seventh additional TAC 265 issued; 12) 17-Nov-15: Due to production limitation of S/Ns attained, the additional TAC 271 was assigned. and production of beacons under TAC 265 was stopped.
PANASONIC CR123A, Lithium Manganese Dioxide (3 cells, 2/3 A size)
GlobalTop Tech Inc., model FGPMMOPA6B, P/N A1-11-0877; GlobalTop Tech Inc. model Gms-hpr, ACR P/N A1-11-0877-1.

(1) The model PLB-375(ResQLink+) is identical to the base model PLB-375, but it has a higher volume case, slightly increased weight, changed center of gravity and added buoyancy. The model "PLB-375 (ResQLink+)" is approved for use while on ground or above ground, it has not been evaluated nor type approved for use while floating in water.
(2) Approved for message encoding with variants of Standard Location Protocol for EPIRB with MMSI, EPIRB with Serial Number, ELT with 24-bit Address, ELT with Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator and PLB with Serial Number, and variants of National Location Protocols for EPIRB, ELT and PLB.

table.column: (1) TAC-201 originally issued in the name of Kannad S.A.S.;(2) 2-Apr-12: TAC 201 re-issued in the name of Orolia S.A.S. (France); (3) 20-Nov-12: Approved for use with the alternative GNSS module Fastrax UC324. (4) 13-Jul-16: Production status changes to "not in production. See product recall note in General Comments section.
Lithium Manganese Dioxide, Panasonic 9 x CR123 cells
- Automatic activation via water switch; - Automatic release mechanism (only model 'Safelink Auto')

Approved for message encoding with Standard Location Protocol variants (EPIRB with MMSI, EPIRB with Serial Number) and National Location protocol for EPIRB, and User-Location protocol ( Maritime ULP with MMSI, Maritime with Radio Call Sign, Radio Call Sign, Float Free EPIRB with Serial Number and Non-Float Free EPIRB with Serial Number). Tested in EPIRB-like configurations only, i.e. corresponding to beacon used while floating in water, on deck of a vessel or in a safety raft.
NOTE for CUSTOMERS: For technical support, battery replacement and other matters related to customer support - please contact Orolia S.A.S. (France).
PRODUCT RECALL NOTICE: Due to a technical issue, which might affect beacon performance and risk the beacon not operating in an emergency situation. OROLIA SAS is recalling all TAC 201 beacon models "SafeLink Auto" and "SafeLink Manual+". For further instructions on your SafeLink beacon return and replacement, please contact Kannad Marine Support on telephone in France: +33 (0) 29702 4931, in UK: +44 (0)2392 623950, in Spain: (+34) 91 655 55 38, in Americas: +1 (800) 262 8722. Alternatively, please visit web-page: http://www.safelinkepirbsupport.co.uk/.

RLB-38 is a variant of RLB-36 with removed OLED and internal GPS receiver. tested in EPIRB configurations, i.e "floating in water" and "above ground". Approved for message encoding with Standard Location Protocol variants (EPIRB with MMSI and EPIRB with Serial Number) and National Location protocol for EPIRB.
RAKON TCXO P/N E4520, PCB Rev A, SW Rev.A, FW Rev. A, battery pack A3-06-2449

tested in EPIRB configurations, i.e. "floating in water" and "above ground". Approved for message encoding with User Protocol variants (Maritime with MMSI , Maritime with Radio Call Sign, EPIRB Non Float Free with Serial Number and Radio Call Sign).

Ultralife U10014, Lithium-Manganese Dioxide, 3 x D-size cells

Special-use EPIRB designed for submarines. Approved for use while floating in water. Approved for message encoding with User-National (long format message) protocol.
Due to specifics of message protocol and some non-compliances, the beacon was approved with a letter of compatibility issued in-lieu of a full type-approval certificate.

(1) Beacon was tested in PLB configuration only, corresponding to beacon operation while "on ground" and "above ground". PANASONIC CR123A, Lithium Manganese Dioxide (3 cells, 2/3 A size)
GlobalTop Tech Inc. model Gms-hpr, ACR P/N A1-11-0877-1.

(1) The model PLB-375(ResQLink+) is identical to the base model PLB-375, but it has a higher volume case, slightly increased weight, changed center of gravity and added buoyancy. The model "PLB-375 (ResQLink+)" is approved for use while on ground or above ground, it has not been evaluated nor type approved for use while floating in water.
(2) Approved for message encoding with variants of Standard Location Protocol for EPIRB with MMSI, EPIRB with Serial Number, ELT with 24-bit Address, ELT with Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator and PLB with Serial Number, and variants of National Location Protocols for EPIRB, ELT and PLB.

SOS-300 was designed tested and approved for operation while placed on ground or above ground. Approved for message encoding with all variants of Standard Location protocol, National Location protocol and User-Location protocol (except ULP - EPIRB Float-Free with serial Number).
SOS-300 is manufactured in black and ACR treuse case colours.

Energizer CR123A, Lithium-Manganese Dioxide, 3 x 3 cells packs

Special-use EPIRB designed for submarines. Approved for use while floating in water. Approved for message encoding with variants of Standard Location protocol ( EPIRB with MMSI and EPIRB with Serial Number), National Location Protocol for EPIRBs, and User-Location Protocol (Maritime with Radio-Call Sign).
Due to specifics of beacon operation in some modes and some non-compliances, the beacon was approved with a letter of compatibility issued in-lieu of a full type-approval certificate.

table.column: 1) 19-Feb-13: TAC 239 issued for PLB model "rescueMe PLB1" 2) 14-Jun-13: model "rescueMe PLB2" approved and added to TAC 239; 3) 2-Feb-15: first additional TAC 260 issued; 4) 27-Jan-17: Due to production limitation on S/N attained, the additional TAC 283 was assigned and production of beacons under TAC 239 was stopped.
Lithium Manganese Dioxide, Energizer 123 Photo, 3 x CR123 cells
GNSS Self-test mode, number of GNSS self-tests is limited to 10 for the battery replacement period of 8 years.

Approved for encoding with the variants of location protocols: Standard Location protocol (EPIRB with MMSI and PLB with Serial Number), National Location for PLB and User-Location (Maritime with MMSI). The beacon rescueME PLB1 is approved for use while on ground or above ground; it has not been designed, tested nor type approved for use while immersed in water.

table.column: 1) 17-Jul-08: RLB-36 approved with TAC-189 2) 19-Mar:09: non-GPS variant RLB-40 approved; 3) 4-Aug-09: RLB-37 variant approved; 4) 18-Dec-09: Alternative PANASONIC CR123A cell added for use with RLB-40; 5) 25-FEB-2010: RLB-38 approved;6) 7-Mar-11: first additional TAC 213 issued; 7) 26-Jun-12: alternative GPS receiver model Wonde Proud A1-11-0688-1 approved for use with RLB-36 and RLB-37; 8) 16-Aug-12: second additional TAC 234 issued; 9) 7-Nov-13: third additional TAC 246 issued; 10) 18-Dec-14: fourth additional TAC 258 issued; 12) 19-Aug-16: fifth additional TAC 278 issued; 13) 7-Feb-17: Due to production limitation on S/N attained, the additional TAC 284 was assigned and production of beacons under TAC 278 was stopped.
SANYO CR123A, Lithium Manganese Dioxide (3x3 cells, 2/3 A size), PANASONIC CR123A, Lithium Manganese Dioxide (3x3 cells, 2/3 A size)
internal GPS receiver, models 'Wonde Proud A1-11-0688-1 '; optical interface to external GPS via NMEA0183 protocol
Automatic activation (water sensor) combined with hydrostatic release mechanism, secondary OLED display

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Lithium Manganese Dioxide (Li-MnO2), Mathews Associates (12 cells of 1794AS0953-type)
100 mW ( 121.5/243 MHz homers are not available in Sarsat Mode 1)
24 hours in Sarsat Mode 1, see general comments below)
Automatic activation on contact with salt water and on ejection from aircraft.

AN/PRC-112G(A) is a special-use multi-mode communicator for operation by trained personnel.
Due to design limitations and non-compliances a letter of compatibility was issued for the Sarsat Mode 1 in lieu of a full type-approval certificate.
Over-use of 121.5/243 MHz voice- transceiver, 121.5/243 MHz swept-tone beacon or other operator-selectable features and modes (other than Sarsat Mode 1) may cause premature depletion of the beacon battery.
Approved for message encoding with Standard Location protocol - PLB with Serial Number, National Location protocol for PLB and User-Location protocol - PLB with serial number.
fully compatible with Cospas-Sarsat standards only when operated in SARSAT Mode 1

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Lithium-Thionyl Chloride, HIT ER14P, 2 x 10 serially-connected cells
24 hrs (see Note 1 in the general comments section below)

voice-transceiver at 121.5 MHz and 156.8 MHz,
automatic activation by water- pressure sensors and by water/flooding sensors

Model "T21-1" and its variants, models "T21-2" and "T21-3" are special-use submarine Float Free EEPIRBs, designated for operation by trained personnel.
Models "T21-2" and "T21-3" are variants of the base model "T21-1" with different body design fit with different water-pressure sensors.
Model "T21-1" and its variants models "T21-2" and "T21-3" were approved for use while floating in water, and for message encoding with User protocol - EPIRB Float Free with MMSI.
NOTE 1: In some modes of operation, the beacon operating lifetime might decrease to 12 hours. Due to this non-compliance, design limitations and other non-compliances, the model "T21-1" and its variants, models "T21-2" and "T21-3" were approved with a letter of compatibility which was issued in-lieu of a full type-approval certificate.

AN/PRC-112G(A) is a special-use multi-mode communicator for operation by trained personnel.

fully compatible with Cospas-Sarsat standards only when operated in SARSAT Mode 1

24 hours in Sarsat Mode 1, see general comments below)

AN/PRC-112G(A), P/N 01-P42900K001, is a special-use multi-mode military communicator designated for operation by trained personnel.
AN/PRC-112G(A) is an upgraded variant of the original PLB model AN/PRC-112G, providing automatic beacon activation.
The beacon is Cospas-Sarsat approved for operation in the "Sarsat Mode 1" while placed/held above ground.
Approved for message encoding with Standard Location protocol - PLB with Serial Number, National Location protocol for PLB and User-Location protocol - PLB with serial number.
Due to the beacon design limitations and non-compliances, a letter of compatibility was issued in lieu of a full type-approval certificate.
Over-use of 121.5/243 MHz voice- transceiver, 121.5/243 MHz swept-tone beacon or other operator-selectable features and modes (other than Sarsat Mode 1) might cause premature depletion of the beacon battery.
AN/PRC-112G(A) is compatible with Cospas-Sarsat System only when operated in Sarsat Mode 1

table.column: Lithium Manganese Dioxide, SAFT LM17500, 2 parallel chains, each comprising 2 serially-connected A-size cells
Internal GPS/GLONASS receiver, model: Ublox NEOM8N with internal patch antenna

Type approved with the following variants of Standard Location protocol: ELT with 24-bit Address, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator, ELT with Serial Number; and with variants of User-Location protocol: Aviation, ELT with Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft Operator and Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft 24-bit Address.
Tested with the integral whip antenna, while the beacon was placed on ground, above ground and floating in water.
TCXO, model E5345 LF, Batt.repl 7.5 years, HW P/N: 51090368-1, SW CS-404-APINT v.3.01

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Lithium Thionyl Chloride (LiSOCl2) primary (non-rechargeable) battery, VIZRO-CELL, cell type: SW-D03, batter pack composition: one cell
24 (in AUTO mode - see General Comments below)
internal GNSS (GPS) receiver model U-blox PAM-7Q
integral antenna SRC Co., Ltd. P/N PSP100ANT
AM-Voice transceiver operating on 243 MHz (only in VOICE mode) for two-way simplex communication.

PSP100 is a special-use PLB for use by military personnel. The beacon was approved for operation while placed on ground or above ground (hand-held). Approved for message encoding with the following protocols: Standard Location - PLB with Serial Number , National Location for PLB, and User-Location - PLB with Serial Number. Due to PSP100 design limitations and some non- compliances, a full type approval was not granted, and the beacon was approved with a letter of compatibility in-lieu of a type-approval certificate.
The design limitations and operation of beacon in the VOICE mode might cause premature depletion of the beacon battery and result in the beacon operating lifetime of less than 24 hours.

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Lithium Manganese Dioxide, Ultralife U10032, 2 x C-size cells
Integral antenna; and detachable trailing VHF/GPS antenna P/N 10-274-18 for use with the models 500-30A-D and 500-30-D when a pilot is parachuting down to ground.

Automatic activation via lanyard;
The 406 MHz transmission and GPS Receiver are both automatically switched off after 24 hours of beacon operation

Model "500-30-D" is a variant of the base model "500-30", equipped with an additional detachable trailing VHF/GPS antenna P/N 10-274-18, and non-operational accessories.
The beacon was tested and approved for operation in PLB configurations , corresponding to "on ground" and "above ground" scenarios.
When a pilot is parachuting down to ground, the model 500-30-D operates with the detachable trailing VHF/GPS antenna P/N 10-274-18. After landing, the detachable antenna shall be removed and the beacon operates with the integral antenna.
Approved for message encoding with: variants of National Location protocols for ELT and PLB; and variants of Standard Location protocol variants for ELT and PLB: ELT with 24-bit Address, ELT with Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator, PLB with Serial Number.

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons

Model 500-30A-D is a variant of the model 500-30A, and it is equipped with an additional detachable trailing VHF/GPS antenna P/N 10-274-18, the RAC CABLE (Remote Activation Cable P/N A02067) for remote beacon activation, and non-operational accessories.
The beacon was tested and approved for operation in PLB configurations , corresponding to "on ground" and "above ground" scenarios.
When a pilot is parachuting down to ground, the model 500-30A-D operates with the detachable trailing VHF/GPS antenna P/N 10-274-18. After landing, the detachable antenna shall be removed and the beacon operates with the integral antenna.
Approved for message encoding with: variants of National Location protocols for ELT and PLB; and variants of Standard Location protocol variants for ELT and PLB: ELT with 24-bit Address, ELT with Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator, PLB with Serial Number.

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Lithium Manganese Dioxide (LiMnO2), Panasonic CR-123A, 2/3 size, 3 battery packs, 3 cells each. Battery pack ACR P/N: A3-06-2865
GlobalTop Tech Inc. P/N gms-hpr , ACR P/N A1-11-0877-1
integral whip antenna, ACR P/N A3-06-2554

Automatic by water sensor (when not in bracket);
GNSS self-test ( 1 burst of 520 ms)

Designed, tested and approved for use while floating in water, or on deck, or in a safety raft.
Approved for mesage encoding with variants of Standard Location protocol (EPIRB with MSI and EPIRB with Serial Number); National Location Protocol for EPIRBs; and all maritime variants of User-Location protocol (Maritime with MMSI, Maritime with Radio-call sign, EPIRB Float Free with Serial Number, EPIRB Non-Float Free with Serial Number, Radio Call Sign).

TCXO: RAKON P/N 5344LF, HW P/N; A3-06-2862, Rev B SW P/N: K3-01-0122, Version B, Release 10/15/2014 PCB P/N: A3-07-0413 Rev G
Battery relacement: 10 years
Encoded position update interval: 20 min to 4 hours

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: 1) 11-Jul-11: originally approved with TAC 219; 2) 9-Sep-11: additional message protocols added; 3) 10-Nov-11: approval of a bouyant variant of PLB-375, model "PLB-375 (ResQLink+)"; 4) 20-Jan-12: First additional TAC 224 issued; 5) 9-Aug-12: Second additional TAC 233 issued; 6) 3-May-13: Third additional TAC 241 issued; 7) 4-Nov-13: Fouth additional TAC 245 issued; 8) 14-Nov-13: Alternative GPS receiver added, GlobalTop Tech Inc. model Gms-hpr, ACR P/N A1-11-0877-1; 9) 29-Jul-14: Fifth additional TAC 254 issued; 10) 18-Dec-14: Sixth additional TAC 257 issued; 11) 29-May-15: Seventh additional TAC 265 was issued; 12) 17-Nov-15: Eighth additional TAC 271 was issued; 13) 4-May-16: Ninth additional TAC 276 was issued; 14) 12-July-16: Replacement of power amplifier, firmware modification to address phase modulation stability, and increase in declared battery life from 5 to 8 years; 15) 14-Oct-16: Tenth additional TAC 279 was issued. 16)12-Apr-17: Eleventh additional TAC 287 was issued.
PANASONIC CR123A, Lithium Manganese Dioxide (3 cells, 2/3 A size)
GlobalTop Tech Inc. model Gms-hpr, ACR P/N A1-11-0877-1

(1) Beacon was tested in PLB configuration only, corresponding to beacon operation while "on ground" and "above ground". (2) Demonstrated full compliance with C/S Standards: C/S T.001 Issue 3 - Rev.11 (October 2010), C/S T.007 Issue 4 - Rev.5 (October 2010). (3) Approved for message encoding with variants of Standard Location Protocol for EPIRB with MMSI, EPIRB with Serial Number, ELT with 24-bit Address, ELT with Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator and PLB with Serial Number, and variants of National Location Protocols for EPIRB, ELT and PLB.

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: ResQLink+, 3Si Guardian Buoyant 406 MHz Personal Locator Beacon
PANASONIC CR123A, Lithium Manganese Dioxide (3 cells, 2/3 A size)
GlobalTop Tech Inc. model Gms-hpr, ACR P/N A1-11-0877-1.

(1) The model PLB-375(ResQLink+) is identical to the base model PLB-375, but it has a higher volume case, slightly increased weight, changed center of gravity and added buoyancy. The model "PLB-375 (ResQLink+)" is approved for use while on ground or above ground, it has not been evaluated nor type approved for use while floating in water.
(2) Approved for message encoding with variants of Standard Location Protocol for EPIRB with MMSI, EPIRB with Serial Number, ELT with 24-bit Address, ELT with Serial Number, ELT with Aircraft Operator Designator and PLB with Serial Number, and variants of National Location Protocols for EPIRB, ELT and PLB.

Type approved with Standard Location Protocol variants: EPIRB with MMSI, EPIRB with Serial Number; National Location protocol: EPIRB; User-Location protocol variants: Maritime with MMSI, Maritime with Radio Call Sign, EPIRB Float Free with Serial Number, EPIRB Non-Float Free with Serial Number, Radio Call Sign.

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Lithium/Iron Disulfide (LiFeS2), Energiser Holdings model L91, 8 cells
internal GPS receiver, model: GlobalTop Gmm-r1, manufacturer: GlobalTop

1) Type approved with the following variants of Standard Location protocols: EPIRB with MMSI, EPIRB with Serial Number; National Location protocol for EPIRB; and variants of User-Location protocol: Maritime with MMSI, Maritime with Radio Call Sign, EPIRB Non Float Free with Serial Number, and Radio Call Sign.
2) Tested in EPIRB-like configurations only, i.e. Corresponding to beacon used while floating in water, on deck of a vessel or in a safety raft.

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: 1) 19-Feb-13: TAC 239 issued for PLB model "rescueMe PLB1" 2) 14-Jun-13: model "rescueMe PLB2" approved and added to TAC 239; 3) 2-Feb-15: first additional TAC 260 issued; 4) 27-Jan-17: second additional TAC 283 issued; 5) 25-Aug-17: Change approved to "rescueME PLB1" synthesizer and GNSS timing.
Lithium Manganese Dioxide, Energizer 123 Photo, 3 x CR123 cells
GNSS Self-test mode, number of GNSS self-tests is limited to 10 for the battery replacement period of 8 years.

Approved for encoding with the variants of location protocols: Standard Location protocol (EPIRB with MMSI and PLB with Serial Number), National Location for PLB and User-Location (Maritime with MMSI). The beacon rescueME PLB1 is approved for use while on ground or above ground; it has not been designed, tested nor type approved for use while immersed in water.

AM-voice transceiver; two-way data messaging; self-navigation; LCD display; automatic beacon activation by water sensor, or by pulling a lanyard attached to the beacon, or by the G-switch in result of acceleration (on ejection from aircraft).

Special use beacon, for operation by trained personnel. Tested in PLB configuration only, corresponding to beacon operation while "on ground" and "above ground" with integral antennas, or while in water with the external "stole" antenna and the GPS receiving "patch" antenna attached to a safety vest. Demonstrated compliance during lifetime test for 15-hours in BCN-mode (State B+C) and for 24 hours in BCN-mode (State C). Over-use of voice transceiver and other ancillary functions may cause premature depletion of the beacon battery and affect beacon ability to transmit 406 MHz signals for the specified operating lifetime.

Lithium-Ion rechargeable battery (LIRB), Li-Ion NMC/Si,
one battery cell, cell models: "1INP63438" , manufacturer - Prollion, France; "1INP6/34/38", manufacturer - One-sixone, France

EMERGENCY is a wrist-worn 406/121.5 MHz emergency PLB which shares casing with a Breitling analog-digital chronograph. The chronograph and the emergency beacon are fully independent. 121.5 MHz homer operates only at temperatures above 0C, homer is automatically disabled at temperatures below 0C. Designed for operation only above ground. Not designed to operate while in water or when the watch is still worn on the wrist. The Li-Ion rechargeable battery shall be fully charged, the battery recharging shall be performed at regular, not exceeding 2 months intervals. Minimum duration of operation is 18 hrs. Approved for message encoding with the User protocol variant for PLBs with Serial Number. Designated for use of qualified and properly instructed customers.

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: ELECTROCHEM 3B75, one D-size cell, replacement period: 3 years

Automatic beacon activation on ejection from aircraft and by G-acceleration switch. Automatically switches to external antennas, when external antennas are connected. external LED - indicator of beacon status integrated with the external receiving GNSS patch antenna.

Special-use PLB for military applications and designated for operation by trained personnel.
Designed, tested and approved for operation with integral antennas while placed on ground or held above ground, and for operation with external antennas only with the external antennas fit on a life-jacket while floating in water.
Approved for message encoding with Standard Location - PLB with Serial Number protocol,and with National Location (PLB) protocol.
Available in two variants: 1) beacon without external antennas (P/N: 21530912730): and 2) beacon with external antennas (P/N: 21530902730).
Due to AN/PRC-648T4 design limitations and some non- compliances, a full type approval was not granted, and the beacon was approved with a letter of compatibility issued in-lieu of a type-approval certificate.

tested in non-standard 'dry-box' and 'wet-box' test configurations

antenna cable attenuation is 0.7- 0.9 dB

table.name: joomla3_cospas_sarsat_tac_beacons
table.column: Lithium/Bromide Chloride, Electrochem type BCX 85 P/N 3B70, 1 (one) C-size cell
Integral transmitting blade antenna (P/N MEA-25000-2103), detachable transmitting trailing antenna (P/N MEA-25000-2205), detachable GPS-receiving trailing antenna (P/N MEA-25000-2301)
Automatic electrical or mechanical beacon activation on ejection from aircraft, ACES II/III Control/Activation assembly, automatic switching to integrated antenna.

Special use beacon, for operation by a trained personnel.
Tested in PLB configurations only, corresponding to beacon operation while "on ground" and "above ground".
The beacon with the integral transmitting blade antenna is approved while it is placed on ground or above ground for operation.
The beacon with the detachable transmitting trailing antenna and the detachable GPS antenna is approved while it is placed for operation above ground .
"406 ONLY" mode and "TRIPLE BEACON" mode are fully compliant, however full type approval was not granted, as an over-use of the "DUAL BEACON" mode (i.e., a non-406 MHz mode with 121.5/243 MHz swept-tone homer only) might cause a premature depletion of the beacon battery.
Approved for message encoding with the National Location protocol for PLB and the Standard Location protocol for PLB with Serial Number.
